alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 5:09AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Large stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio and West Virginia, including the following counties, in southeast Ohio, Washington. In West Virginia, Calhoun, Doddridge, Gilmer, Harrison, Jackson, Lewis, Pleasants, Ritchie, Tyler, Wirt and Wood. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, large creeks, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding is occuring on Middle Island Creek, Duck Creek, and the Little Muskingum River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarksburg, Marietta, Harrisville, St. Marys, Elizabeth, Bridgeport, Williamstown, Shinnston, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Salem, Sistersville, Pennsboro, Belmont, Lumberport, West Union, Anmoore, North Bend State Park, Boaz and Mineralwells. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
